newsitem.title: FRANCE: European car sales up 8.5 percent in 1996 - ACEA. [CORRECTED 12:05 GMT]
newsitem.headline: European car sales up 8.5 percent in 1996 - ACEA. [CORRECTED 12:05 GMT]

text.p: New car sales in Western Europe posted a 8.5 percent year-on-year rise in December 1996, leaving total sales for the year up 6.6 percent (corrects from 6.5 percent) compared with the previous twelve months, the European Automobile Manufacturers Association (ACEA) said on Tuesday.
Passenger car sales rose to 774,300 in December in the 15-member European Union, Norway, Switzerland and Lichenstein, compared with 727,300 in December 1996.
That left total sales for the year at 12,803,700 up from 12,096,900 in 1995.
(Corrects after ACEA said a mistake had been made in calculations by official German government sources)
